instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_WLAN: What is PP3V3_WLAN? PP3V3_WLAN is a 3.3v power rail that powers the wifi circuit or wifi card. This can go missing when the inductor acting as a fuse before PP3V3_WLAN blows..
definitions.SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN: What is SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN? SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on power to the wifi circuit when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message:
I have this 00165 that won’t detect WiFi card.

After a PRAM reset it detects and works for around 30 minutes and then goes back to not detecting. I can then make another PRAM reset and it works again for another 30 minutes and the story continues over and over.

I already tried another known good WiFi card...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message: Inspect for corrosion around <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> and the SMC itself.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message: No liquid. According to the customer WiFi just stopped working one day. No corrosion to be found after inspection. It has been to another repair shop who offered a logic board replacement. Only thing I noticed when taking apart was that the WiFi card was a little bit looser than normal when taking it out of socket connector. Probably because the other repair shop had taking the card in and out a thousand of times. I replaced the connector but problem is the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message: <CHIP>U3550</CHIP> looking all clean?  I've had corrosion appear there on seemingly perfect boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message: Looked clean yesterday when inspecting from the top. I’ll have a closer look at it from the side later today.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message: No corrosion at <CHIP>U3550</CHIP>. Also <SIGNAL>PP3V3_WLAN</SIGNAL> is ok at 3.3V all the time both when the machine detects but also when not detecting the WiFI card.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>AP_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>.
Also check CLK100M presence at J3501.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>AP_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL> = 0 (3.3 when working)
<SIGNAL>P_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> = 0 (3.0 when working)
<SIGNAL>SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.4

CLK100M not present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>P_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> = 0 (3.0 when working)"
Are you sure???
<SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> should be low.
We don't want active reset, but we want active clok request; both have _L at the end.
Check if <SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_Q_L</SIGNAL> is low; must be tied to ground on airport card.
Consider changing <CHIP>U3540</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message: I will double check it and get back

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No WiFi hardware installed
threads.message:
Thanks for the effort. Customer got another board. I still have this board here and I will post again if I ever get back to it.... 

Thanks again
